entry.title: Recent Open Access Doctoral Theses from UCL
entry.content:
Recent Open Access Doctoral Theses from UCL

Institute of Archaeology
  • Anguilano, L.; (2012) Roman lead silver smelting at Rio Tinto: the case study of Corta Lago. Doctoral thesis, UCL (University College London). 
    Bains, RK; (2012) The social significance of Neolithic stone bead technologies at Çatalhöyük. Doctoral thesis, UCL (University College London).
  • Bushnell, LJ; (2013) The Socio-Economic Implications of the Distribution of Juglets in the Eastern Mediterranean during the Middle and Late Bronze Age. Doctoral thesis, UCL (University College London). 
  • Dickinson, T; (2014) A Landscape and Materials-based Approach to Royal Mortuary Architecture in Early Third Millennium BC Egypt. Doctoral thesis, UCL (University College London).
  • Dikomitou, M; (2012) Ceramic production, distribution, and social interaction. An analytical approach to the study of Early and Middle Bronze Age pottery from Cyprus. Doctoral thesis, UCL (University College London).  
  • HADDOW, SD; (2012) Dental Morphological Analysis of Roman Era Burials from the Dakhleh Oasis, Egypt. Doctoral thesis, UCL (University College London).
  • Page, SN; (2014) Cultural transmission of lithic artefact traditions: an experimental approach. Doctoral thesis, UCL (University College London). 
  • Panagiotou, A; (2015) A comparative analysis of the decorated pottery of the second millennium BC Eastern Mediterranean. Doctoral thesis, UCL (University College London). 
Department of Greek and Latin
  •  Gotsi, A.; (2012) Irish Antigones. Doctoral thesis, UCL (University College London).
  • Papastamati, S; (2013) Gamos in archaic and classical Greek poetry: theme, ritual and metaphor. Doctoral thesis, UCL (University College London).
